Not only can players access the bridges, but they can go into the water and have access to ladders that lead them back up to the top.
Tips and Tricks:
   Bridge is one of the smallest maps in the game, and combat seems everywhere. What do you do?
   Get to the high ground, this will allow you to spot players and shred them to pieces.
   Consider the water area, because from the top you can destroy almost any player.
   At the start of each game, if you spawn near the houses in front of the cave, the opposite team spawns in the cave. This allows easy spawn killing at the start of the game.
Trivia:
   The map originally appeared in private servers before it's initial addition.
   Bridge, Abandoned Arena, Glacier, and Poolside appeared in private servers before their initial release.
   This is the first map to be released in 2020.
   In a small cave-like area, there are minecarts.
   The low gravity feature on private servers sometimes doesn't work when you are touching water.
Map History:
   01/31/20: Added into the game of Arsenal as a private servers-only map.
   02/05/20: Bridge updated.
   02/10/20: Bridge updated and added into public rotation.
   06/26/20: Removed from the public rotation.

removedmaps.name: COMPLEX
removedmaps.info:
General Information:
   Complex is a map in Arsenal that was released on January 15, 2019, removed upon the Summer Update's start and was added back into the game and remastered in the Anniversary Update. The map takes place in a 4-story office complex with office rooms, a storage room, and vents that can be accessed.
Tips and Tricks:
   Such a perfect office complex in the middle of the city, right? Wrong, this complex is filled with players out to battle with their guns! The level-dependent complex can be either annoying or epic. Either way, there are strategies to master this map and unusual stuff in an office.
   Always go to the higher levels to take advantage of enemies easier.
   The vents can help you flank the players without getting hurt.
   The stairs can help access to the top of the building.
   The truss ladders on the side of the building can also help access multiple levels of the building.
Trivia:
   The map begun its development on September 27, 2018.
   The map can be played here.
   This map was originally made for ROLVe's other game, Robber, however, DevRolve liked it and decided to put it on the rotation in Arsenal.
   In the Anniversary Update, the bottom floor part was removed by developers. This is because most players never battle at the bottom floor, so they decided to remove the bottom floor almost entirely.
   The stairs are next to player spawns so they have access to get on the roof easily instead of rocket jumping.
Map History:
   01/15/19: Added into Arsenal.
   06/05/19: Removed from the public rotation.
   11/27/19: Remastered and re-added back to the public rotation.
   06/26/20: Removed from the public rotation.

removedmaps.name: POOLSIDE
removedmaps.info:
Map Information:
   Poolside is a map in Arsenal that was added to private servers on June 16th, 2019. It was officially released in the July Update on July 5th, 2019. It takes place at a giant pool surrounded with multiple buildings. Poolside was re-added in the second Summer Update but was removed 2 days later.
   It features a pool, a basketball court, a DJ Set, buildings on either side of the map, and many other unique features. It is quite larger than some of the other maps currently in the game and can be played in most gamemodes.
Trivia:
   The map begun its development on June 9th, 2019, 2 weeks before it was eventfully added.
   The map can be played here.
   Shooting the yellow plaque on the pool wall flashes up a message saying Poolside by IcyTea, a reference to one of the creators of the map, IcyTea.
   There is a poster on the right building which shows John Brick pointing a Golden Gun saying Youre Breathtaking!. This is a reference to E3 2019 in which Keanu Reeves (who's most notable for acting in John Wick as the titular character) points at a person in the audience and says the same thing.
   There were used to be bathrooms in the buildings and most secrets in the map. However, it was later removed when it was revamped.
Map History:
   06/16/19: Added into the game of Arsenal as a private servers-only map.
   07/05/19: Added to the public rotation.
   10/04/19: Removed from the public rotation.
   06/20/20: Revamped and re-added back to the public rotation.
   06/26/20: Removed from the public rotation.
   03/16/21: Removed from private servers.

removedmaps.name: SUBWAY
removedmaps.info:
General Information:
   Subway is a map that takes place in an underground subway station. Both sides of the map are identical, with multiple rooms and a railing that runs around the map. At the end of each side, there is a hallway that has multiple exits and a ladder that leads to a vent on the second floor. Two trains will go through the middle of the map's railroads at a very fast rate, however only the front of the trains will deal environmental kills. Around the map, there are many barricades, boards, and boxes scattered.
Tips and Tricks:
   Trains whoosh by as bullets fly everywhere across the map. How do you survive?
   When the subway trains pass by, use this time to replenish health and reload your weapons. This makes you ready for battle when the trains go away.
   This may be risky, but from the top floor, jump on top of the subway trains while they are moving and jump on the enemy team.
   Most of the fighting is in the center of the map, so go up to the second floor to go to the other side of the map without getting hit by trains.
   While on the second floor, you have the high ground to mow down your enemies.
   You can shoot through the ramps and the second floor allowing you to get some kills without the enemy expecting it.
   There are vents just above the second floor on either side of the subway station. Although you don't get a good view from the sides, you can shoot at any enemy players on the second floor and parts of the first. All the while, making you stealthy as people rarely check the vents.
Trivia:
   Unlike other moving hazards, only the front of the trains kill you.
   This map is the 2nd map to be made by AzireBlox that is added into Arsenal, the first being Silo 20.
Map History:
   03/25/20: Added into the Post-Showtime! Update of Arsenal.
   06/26/20: Removed from the public rotation.

murdermaps.name: OFFICE
murdermaps.info:
General Information: 
   Office is the first map to be added in MURDER. This map takes place around an office complex with parking areas outside of the building during the winter season. There are containers, a ladder and stairways around the map that can lift and leads the player inside the office.
There's also a parked van reflected through the window at the terrorists' spawn.
This map is taken from Counter Blox.

murdermaps.name: AGENCY
murdermaps.info:
General Information: 
 Agency is a map originally from Counter-Strike: Global Offensive as a hostage map. It takes place in a commercial penthouse ontop of a skyscraper. The interior is a two-floor office. The first floor has a giant, open lobby with stairs leading up to the second floor, along with two hallways leading to a small cafeteria and a large space. Said large space is overlooked by a balcony.
On the second floor, the stairs from the lobby lead into an office space, which connects via an upstairs balcony-way to the main offices. The main offices contains a conference room, a janitor closet, and workspaces.
Agency has multiple windows on the second-floor main office, though they do not have glass, unlike its origin, Counter Blox. Falling off the map causes the player to lose a level since it is an environmental kill.
Around the map are several colored balls. The colors of these balls include red, yellow, green, blue, purple, and pink.
 Tips and Tricks:
   Agency is a map with many rooms, and action happening at every corner. How do you survive?
The map is mainly suited for close-quarters, up-close and personal combat.
Explosive-weapons such as the M16A2 are extremely devastating at close range: With hardly any room to maneuver in such tight space, a single blast could kill multiple players in one shot.
Shotguns also find their niche here, with their capability to fill a narrow, tight space with dozens of pellets in a second.
If you climb up the staircase in the room that leads outside, you can find some small openings to shoot through.

murdermaps.name: MIAMI
murdermaps.info:
General Information:
 Miami is a map in MURDER. This map takes place at night in the Rations Bank in Miami. This map has multiple vents, as tons of small, enclosed areas, numerous of cameras and a opened safe. Most green items will spawn in the main, large area.
 An few of the entrances are blocked by untouchable furniture not to let any players to be difficult to find around the map.
 Trivia:
   Many assets of the map are taken from other ROLVe projects and VALVe props.
 The map is a recreated version of Miami Heat (cz_miami) from Counter-Strike: Condition Zero: Deleted Scenes.
 A remake of the map was made in 2014 by Shorty from the CS:GO workshop, which can be found here.
 This map was finished on June 6, 2017, two years before MURDER came out.
 Map History:
   01/13/20: Added into MURDER and updated with;
 Outside is inaccessible.
 More props were added.
 Cabinets can be picked up.
 Vent to bathroom is taller.
 01/26/20: Miami updated with:
 Added more props around the map, which include various office supplies; some of which may become loot.
 Computer monitors, trash cans, and office chairs can now be picked up.
 Adjusted collision on several prop types.
 Movement in the vents is now quite audible.
 In spectator mode, you can see through all vents now.
 More variety for coffee mugs.
 Attempted to fix glitching through vents.
 Removed some unnecessary background props.

murdermaps.name: 67TH WAY
murdermaps.info:
Map Information:
   67th Way takes place on a suburban street and contains two tunnels, a big house, a prison, a gun shop, and a building that is under construction.
 Cars occasionally drive along the street at a high speed and can kill players upon any sort of contact with them. If a player is killed by the cars, they likely will be demoted unless an enemy tagged them prior to their death.
 Trivia:
   This was the first map to have moving obstacles pass through the map that could kill the player. Other maps include Boulevard, Street Corner and Subway.
 As of now, the cars on both directions are currently broken.
 The map is a recreated version of the map with the same name in Garry's Mod.
 There is also a hidden underground bunker and a farm area in the map that can be seen through free-spectating.
 Map History:
   01/15/19: Added into Arsenal, added clips, and fixed ladders.
 01/29/19: Changes to 67th Way.
 02/25/19: Removed from the public rotation.
 07/05/19: Re-added to the public rotation.
 10/28/19: Removed from the public rotation.

murdermaps.name: ROOFTOP
murdermaps.info:
Map Information:
 Rooftop is the fifth map to be added into MURDER in the February update. It is also one of the first maps to be added to MURDER in 2020. It is taken from ROLVe's other game, Typical Colors 2.
 Rooftop takes place in the middle of the night, with two bases and wooden planks connected to a hanging construction bar. Falling into the black abyss below will lead to death. By each base, there is a section beneath divided into two parts, and one has a secret passage way leading to an underground office, with a flight of stairs. Rooftop also has a cellular tower at the very middle, as well as a deactivated middle point. There are RED and GRN signs posted, from the original map in Typical Colors 2. It also has a stairwell by the cellar tower leading to the rooftop of two small buildings.
 Trivia:
   Rooftop is the second night-time map to be added into MURDER.
 This map is a recreated version of Team Fortress 2 custom map, koth_rooftop created by JT.
 Map History:
   02/24/20: Added into the game of MURDER.

murdermaps.name: ASSAULT
murdermaps.info:
Map Information:
 Assault is a recreated version of the popular CS:GO and CS Source map known as: cs_assault. It takes place around an industrial warehouse, with access to the area being blocked off. It's separated into 5 distinct parts, the train station, the warehouse on the left side of the map, the two parallel streets next to them, and the long street that connects the warehouse and the parallel streets.
 The Warehouse has an upper section and a lower section. The upper section has a door in the back that leads to one of the parallel streets, and there is also a door in the lower section that leads to the same street. There is a larger warehouse door that leads to the long street.
 The Train Station is positioned above the rest of the landmarks, making it a good place to camp.
 The two parallel streets just lead onto the main connecting road. People will spawn at the end of these roads, so it's nice to dip around and shoot some of them. The two parallel roads are connected by a small alleyway that houses a few trash bags and broken cars.
 The main street connects all of the previous landmarks. You can enter the warehouse, go onto either of the two parallel streets and walk up to the train station. There aren't any decent barricades on this street, and makes you slightly easier to hit.
 Tips and Tricks:
   A map straighter than a railgun shot, choked by a small garage, accented by a stocked warehouse, and tied into a knot of endless firefight with the trademark train station, Assault is a map that has two simple states of combat: constant straight shooting chaos, or hilariously one-sided vantage pushes. Considering that most matches in Arsenal aren't that coordinated, you can count on the first happening most of the time.
 Many weapons that have tight spread and good accuracy are extremely powerful in this map due to the amount of open space and straight sightlines. Snipers are also considerably more useful than normal thanks to this, allowing potentially awful weapons such as the M40 and MS556 to become somewhat easier to get past.
 Common spawns are in the warehouse, at the end of the streets, and near the stairs that lead to the top of the train station. The warehouse spawn is one you'll want to target often as there is little chance for interruption thanks to it being a closed space. You'll likely snag several kills if you place your shots right as most would be expecting the enemy to come from outside the warehouse, so get flanking!
 Rocket/recoil jumping poses a large advantage, going quickly from one side of the map to another. This becomes much more useful when you reach the roof of the garage, as it not only covers the roof of the warehouse, but pretty much every other part of the map aside from inside the warehouse. You can also access the train station roof, a more niche spot due to it making you a bigger target than Hackula, but somewhat useful as well. It's got a nice view, after all.
 Spawncamps are really prevalent and easy to perform in this map, especially on the street spawns. These spawns have ZERO protection, so whoever spawns there will fall victim to anybody aiming in the general direction of them. If you happen to see someone pop into existence in that general area, raise hell.
 Knifing in general on this map is pretty painful, thanks to how open it is. The only remotely viable spots to even attempt it is in the warehouse, garage, and the stairs up to the train station. Even then, it's really easy to get any of your tries to demote your foes shot down. This makes the Golden Knife difficult to kill with, as you have to hope and pray that an opponent will be lined up in what would essentially be a perfect spot. Try to go for the good knife spots, or just camp around and challenge a knife fight in the warehouse if you're feeling chicken.
 Trivia:
   The map begun its development on May 26th, 2018.
 The map can be played here.
 In the 2.4 Update, the map was changed to be forced on 2 teams.
 However, on 02/13/20, this was reverted back and remains like that to this day.
 Map History:
   01/15/19: Added into the game of Arsenal.
 01/29/19: Changes to Assault.
 02/01/19: Assault is forced on 2 teams.
 02/13/19: Assault is now free to 4 teams and FFA.
 05/31/19: Fixed vent collision and box spawn.
 06/05/19: 2 collision fixes for Assault.
 06/06/19: Adjusted lighting to Assault.
 06/09/19: OOB fixes to Assault.
 09/01/19: Fixed collision on the tracks.
 11/19/19: Icon updated.
 08/15/20: Fixed the blue box.

murdermaps.name: BOULEVARD
murdermaps.info:
Map Information:
   Boulevard is a map released in the 2.5 update. It's a very large and spacey map that favors long-ranged weapons such as snipers, or perfectly accurate weapons. However, it does provide some areas where you can confront enemies in closer ranged combat, so inaccurate weapons are not completely useless.
 Boulevard takes place in a residential suburban city with multiple shops.
 The map features many places to go into. These things include a track where a trolley comes to run over anyone in its path, resulting in a demotion (you can hear it coming by its ringing sound); a gas station called Scoobies; a coffee shop called Stinky is; a juice store called Stink Juice; and multiple vehicles scattered around the area.
 The small buildings have nice rooms that overlook the main road and gas station. As long as the area is secured with a small team, domination is essentially guaranteed. However, retaliating players may simply counter-snipe or use explosives to dislodge you.
 Tips and Tricks:
   Boulevard is a very open map with action in specific areas. How do you win?
 If you have shotguns or high spread automatics, these are your best friends at the gas station, parking lot, and inside the buildings.
 If you happen to have a weapon with the Rocket/Shotgun Jumping ability, use this to your advantage to hide on top of buildings to mow your enemies down below.
 The spawn locations on this map can give you and your team a great opportunity to corner the enemy.
 The trolley can be easily avoided because of its distinctive sound, however, this does not mean to always stay at its path.
 Scoped weapons such as the Barrett or the G11 can be easily used for picking off enemies at longer ranges.
 The Golden Knife is arguably the best or worst in situations. For flanking, either go behind the office buildings or behind Stinky's Coffee shop.
 The skin Froggy is obtainable here by killing 5 people near a frog. The frog will get bigger and bigger until it will start hopping to get the skin. You have to follow it and it will lead you to a door with wood on it. You have to break that wood and when you're finished breaking it, it will teleport you to a different server with a different map, the Apartment. You will see a stand with moving animals on it. You have to shoot all the animals except the frog until confetti comes out of the stand, and that means you got the Froggy skin
 You can get the unusual Froggy skin by doing the Froggy quest normally, but you have to time the Frog and the train to make them collide.
 Trivia:
   The gas station, Scoobies is a reference to the mispronunciation of Scoobis, created by zKevin. The gas station store (Biggie Mart) even has a Scoobies easter-egg in one of the fridges.
 One of the gas pumps has Roblox studio is loading written on it, which may or may have not happened because a certain viewer gave a suggestion.
 The gas station was previously named Milo, and had a picture of Milo. It had to be changed as it is currently a picture of a duck with oops under it.
 as of 07/5/2019, it has been changed to a low-quality image of a yellow car.
 Scapter's Wizard hat is seen on a dumpster near the gas station, this appeared after his account got deleted.
 You can find Kevin from Ed Edd N' Eddy in the juice store.
 There is a pair of binoculars on top of the brick building in between Scoobies & Stinky's Coffee.
 You can find Stinky's Coffee cups around the map.
 The background buildings are based on buildings in San Francisco's Fillmore district.
 TC has his name on a computer screen in the bookstore.
 During the development live stream, it was a picture of a Robloxian in a gray sweater, and black pants wearing a top hat holding a radio saying I shall rain hellfire upon everyone., this was removed.
 This map's development was also streamed, much like Hillside.
 The sign at Stinky's Coffee shows it has a drive-thru, and it's stylized as a 'Drive-and-wait-for-15-minutes-thru'.
 On the map, StinkBooks is having a special offer: buy one, get none.
 During the development of this, TC was searching for an image of a trolley and Redacted By TCTully's special cowboy agency.
 Boulevard currently holds the Froggy quest.
 The time between a tram passing through boulevard varies. Anywhere from 10-15 seconds to 2+ minutes.
 Map History:
   02/14/19: Added into the 2.5 Update of Arsenal.
 02/15/19: Changes to Boulevard.
 06/21/20: Added a frog as a part of the Froggy quest.
 10/29/20: Added the Froggy unusual steps.

murdermaps.name: BANK
murdermaps.info:
Map Information:
 Bank is a legacy map from Pre-Filtering Enabled Arsenal.
 This map is a replica of the de_bank map from Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. It was removed from the Arsenal map rotation in mid-2016.
 The map features the main bank, which is having restorations, because of this, there is a ladder to the top of the building. Inside the bank, there is a lobby that features little decor. Next to the bank, there is a industrial building with a truck that has skidded off course. There are other buildings on the opposite side.
 Trivia:
   The teller's desk is supposed to be facing the right wall in the Counter-Strike: Global Offensive version.
 This is the third map to not be exclusive to private servers after their removal, first being Canyon, second being de_vertigo, fourth being Aztec, fifth being Delta (before the revamp), sixth being Nuke Bunker, seventh being the original Safehouse.
 Map History:
   02/09/16: Added into Gun Game.
 04/21/16: Taken to the ALPHA phase of Arsenal.
 04/25/16: Removed from Arsenal.

murdermaps.name: NUKE
murdermaps.info:
Map Information:
 Nuke is a map exclusive to MURDER that is based off of the map from the Counter-Strike Franchise named de_nuke. The map takes place in the ROLVe Creek Nuclear Power Plant. There are multiple silos and boxes scattered around the map. Inside the power plant, there is bombsite A. On the bottom floor, there is bombsite B. There are multiple interactive canned goods around the map, such as tomato soup, Bloxiade, and Bloxy Cola.
 Trivia:
   The only difference between this version and the Counter Blox's version is that there's a bunker hatch and two more props in the ladder room.
 This map was made by the most amount of developers; 7.
 There is a easter egg that can be found in spectator mode and it shows two pictures and the names of the users who created the map.

murdermaps.name: ITALY
murdermaps.info:
General Information:
   Italy is a MURDER map that was released on 05/14/20. This map takes place at daytime inside a village.
 The village contains some accessible buildings, with one of them having a basement. There are also some narrow passageways between each buildings or between the wall and a building, leading to the market. Near the entrance of Italy, there are paths to take the second floor. Loot is usually spotted easy and hard to find in this map due to boxes being big and some waste being small.
 Trivia:
   This is the second murder map to be based on a real-life location.
 This is based on map of the same name from CS:GO.
 Map History:
   05/15/20: Added into MURDER.
